description: Dive into "Chennai's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chennai's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits

places.generalDescription: Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Elliot Beach, serves as a serene retreat from the bustling city life. This vibrant beach is brimming with activities that cater to all ages. Families can enjoy the playful atmosphere with kids' play areas featuring attractions like a Ferris wheel. The beach is also a haven for food lovers, offering an array of delicious street food options and charming vendors selling fresh flowers.

sources.snippet: Situated approximately 40 km south of Chennai, Covelong Beach offers a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle. This pristine stretch of coastline features soft sands, crystal-clear waters, and a tranquil ambiance, making it a favourite destination for beach enthusiasts and water sports aficionados alike. Visitors can indulge in activities such as surfing, swimming, or simply soaking up the sun while admiring the scenic beauty of the surroundings.
sources.shortName: Chennai Beaches: Exploring the coastal charms of Chennai; A guide to the best beaches

sources.snippet: Overlooking the sea, the Ashtalakshmi Temple majestically stands on the shores of Elliot‚Äôs Beach. Consecrated in 1976, the temple is dedicated to the 8 forms of Goddess Lakshmi, believed to be the bestower of wealth and prosperity in Hinduism. The temple has a multi-tier structure, measuring a length of 65 feet and a breadth of 45 feet.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

places.name: Besant Nagar Beach

reviews.text:
My Favourite spot in Chennai.
Morning sunrise view is an Eye Catchy.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Edward Elliot's Beach is one of the most popular and serene beaches in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Located in the upscale neighborhood of Besant Nagar, this beach is a favorite spot for locals and tourists looking for a peaceful seaside experience.

Highlights

Scenic Beauty: A clean and less crowded alternative to Marina Beach, offering beautiful sunrise and sunset views.

Restaurants & Cafes: The area around the beach is home to many famous eateries like Murugan Idli Shop, Jonah's Bistro, and Mash Resto Caf√©.

The nearby Ashtalakshmi Temple and Velankanni Church attract visitors for spiritual experiences.

A great place for morning or evening walks, jogging, or just relaxing by the sea.

I recently visited Besant Nagar Beach, and I must say, it's one of the most beautiful and serene beaches I've ever been to! Located in the heart of Chennai, this beach is a tranquil oasis that's perfect for a relaxing day out.

Cleanliness and Maintenance:
The beach is actually clean and well-maintained.

Scenic Views:
The beach offers breathtaking views of the Bay of Bengal, especially during sunrise and sunset. The picturesque Elliot's Promenade, which runs along the beach, is perfect for a leisurely walk or jog.

Food and Drink Options:
There are plenty of food stalls and restaurants nearby, offering a range of delicious food options and other local cuisine. Don't forget to try some of the fresh coconut water and local snacks!

Overall Experience:
Besant Nagar Beach is an absolute must-visit if you're in Chennai! Whether you're looking to relax, take a leisurely walk, or simply enjoy the scenic views, this beach has something for everyone.

Tips and Recommendations

- Best time to visit: Early morning or late evening to avoid the crowds and heat.
- Wear comfortable clothing and footwear, and don't forget your sunscreen and sunglasses!
- Try some of the local food options at the nearby restaurants.
- Be mindful of your belongings and personal safety, especially during peak hours.

Originally planned to visit other spots but somehow ended up here instead. üåä Reached around 4 PM, and it was a bit sunny with hardly anyone around. Within an hour, while we were at a nearby shop, the place got Crowded-seems like we picked the perfect timing! üì∏ Got some good clicks too!

I had visited this beach ages ago, but it has Developed significantly since then. Noticed some great improvements, like a ramp for the physically challenged ‚ôø and an increase in the number of shops. The beach is full of vibrant energy, with plenty of activities and games to enjoy. üèñÔ∏èüéà

Compared to Marina & Pattinapakkam, this place has a unique charm for me-maybe a personal connection, who knows? üòÑ Besant Nagar Beach feels quieter, cleaner, and well-organized, making it perfect for a Peaceful walk, reading, or simply enjoying the waves. üåä‚ú® Definitely a must-visit spot!

places.address: 34, Elliot's Promenade, Odaimanagar, Besant Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600090, India

places.generalDescription: Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Elliot's Beach or Bessie, is a serene and unexplored spot in Chennai. It offers a relaxing view with its swaying coconut trees and the sea. Located along the Marina Beach Road, it is one of the must-visit beaches in Chennai. The beach attracts crowds from early morning to evening for fun activities and to enjoy the cool sea breeze.

sources.snippet: Besant Nagar Beach is named after the British writer and first female president of the Indian National Congress, Annie Beasant. This is one of the best family beaches and it attracts both Indian and international tourists throughout the year. It is an arch-shaped beach that has recently gained the interest of many photographers and filmmakers and has served as a backdrop in major Tamil & Malayalam movies.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Chennai | Beaches near Chennai

sources.snippet: Known for its cleanliness and upscale surroundings, Besant Nagar Beach, affectionately referred to as ‚ÄúBessy,‚Äù is a favorite destination among locals in Chennai. This beach, also known as Elliots Beach, offers an exceptional leisure experience. The high-end neighborhood surrounding the beach is home to a variety of shopping options, adding to the appeal of the area.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

places.name: Besant Nagar Beach

reviews.text:
My Favourite spot in Chennai.
Morning sunrise view is an Eye Catchy.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Edward Elliot's Beach is one of the most popular and serene beaches in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Located in the upscale neighborhood of Besant Nagar, this beach is a favorite spot for locals and tourists looking for a peaceful seaside experience.

Highlights

Scenic Beauty: A clean and less crowded alternative to Marina Beach, offering beautiful sunrise and sunset views.

Restaurants & Cafes: The area around the beach is home to many famous eateries like Murugan Idli Shop, Jonah's Bistro, and Mash Resto Caf√©.

The nearby Ashtalakshmi Temple and Velankanni Church attract visitors for spiritual experiences.

A great place for morning or evening walks, jogging, or just relaxing by the sea.

Besant Nagar Beach offers a refreshing coastal escape with beautiful sunsets, clean sands, spiritual landmarks, and vibrant street food-in a much calmer setting than busy city beaches. However, be mindful of rising vendor clutter and occasional sanitation concerns. Overall, it's a top choice for a relaxed day out, especially in the mornings or evenings.

Best experience you can get here. We went on a weekday and it's more quieter than marina beach during night. Nice walking path in the beach and it's clean. There is also skating park for kids.

The shops are clean and as it's weekday not all shops opened. Overall a must visit beach in Chennai. Don't miss this even if u miss Marina beach.

places.address: 34, Elliot's Promenade, Odaimanagar, Besant Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600090, India

places.generalDescription: Marina Beach in Chennai is a favorite spot for both locals and tourists. Besides its expansive sandy shores, the beach offers a range of activities and attractions. Visitors can explore the city's government museum, visit the planetarium, or enjoy sunset views while savoring fried seafood snacks. The area also boasts wildlife spotting opportunities at the Snake Park and Guindy National Park.

sources.snippet: Besides the beach, people can also enjoy the historical places and structures which are positioned along this beach to increase the information about the city of Chennai. Annadurai and MGR memorials, statues of heroes from Tamil culture, Triumph of Labor; these statues and historical monuments are best places for tourists to know about the legends and glorious history of Indian freedom. Apart from these historical reminiscences, Marina is also quite popular for its joggers track, aquarium, and other interesting spots suited to all age groups.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach Chennai, History of Marina Beach, Hotels near Marina

sources.snippet: As a matter of fact, this memorial marks the beginning of the 13 km stretch of the beach. For instance, The roundabout pathway surrounding the memorial was earlier called the ‚ÄúCupid‚Äôs Bow‚Äù. As a matter of fact, this is where the high society met, conversed and romanced during the British era in early 19th century.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach offers you a plethora of things to see and do, from enjoying the natural beauty and scenery to exploring the nearby places and attractions. Here are some of the activities you can indulge in at Marina Beach:
sources.shortName: Marina Beach: A Complete Guide to Chennai‚Äôs Iconic Beach

places.name: Marina Beach

reviews.text: The beach has improved itself over the years. To be said when i first came to chennai the beach was barren and shops filled the beach and there were trash here and there. But now the beach is so beautiful.  The air and the sea feels so good over the evening and night sky.

To my surprise, the beach was much cleaner than it was before.
It was not maintained properly earlier, but the beach is clean compared to earlier days.
Now it definitely a must visit place in Chennai.

I'm planning a Marina Beach visit for my photo assignment. Beaches and animals fascinate me. My last trip was unforgettable tall lighthouse, playful dogs, fishermen readying boats, cool breeze and a vibrant sunrise. The peaceful yet lively scene was a perfect mix of nature, energy and emotion I hope to capture again.

places.generalDescription: Taj Fisherman's Cove Resort & Spa Chennai is a chic tropical-themed retreat that offers a luxurious and unique experience for global travelers. Nestled by the Bay of Bengal, this beach resort provides a tranquil ambiance and various dining options that promise an unforgettable culinary journey. The accommodation includes rooms, cottages, and villas designed for relaxation.

sources.snippet: Attracting tourists from far and wide, one of the renowned beach resorts in ecr is Taj Fisherman's Cove Resort & Spa. Overlooking the cerulean waters of the Bay of Bengal, the luxury resort has a historical significance as it was constructed on the site of an old Dutch Fort. Cottages, villas, and suite rooms are well adorned with modern amenities and will render a cozy stay.
sources.shortName: 20 Beach Resorts in Chennai, Book Now & Get Upto 50% Off

places.name: Taj Fisherman's Cove Resort & Spa Chennai

reviews.text:
From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with such warmth and hospitality. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, always greeting us with a smile and ensuring every little detail was taken care of. The property itself is beautiful and peaceful - the perfect escape with stunning views and cozy vibes.

Special thanks to the Kaini for her impeccable service and for making our stay feel so personal and memorable. We're taking back lovely memories and can't wait to return. Highly recommended!

The location is excellent-right by the sea with sweeping views and a calm, relaxing atmosphere.

Staff were warm, courteous, and helpful throughout the stay. Service felt personal and welcoming.

The beach access is a real plus, though it depends on tide and weather conditions. When open, it's perfect for a morning walk or evening stroll.

The pool, gardens, and open spaces are beautifully maintained and ideal for unwinding.

Food was enjoyable, especially the fresh seafood. The open-air dining setup adds to the experience.

A peaceful retreat. Worth visiting if you're looking for quiet time by the coast.

Taj Fisherman's Cove is a beautiful property with a classic charm. Though it is an older resort, it has been maintained well and feels welcoming. The food is absolutely delicious, and overall service is very good.

However, there were a couple of drawbacks. The moment you enter the room, there is an unpleasant smell from the toilet, which seems to be a plumbing issue that really needs attention. Also, while the hotel is beachfront, the beach itself isn't particularly great, so don't expect that to be the highlight of your stay.

places.address: Lake View Road, Kovalam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 603112, India

places.generalDescription: Edward Elliot's Beach, also known as Besant Nagar Beach or Bessie, is a popular destination in Chennai. Named after British explorer Edward Elliot, this beach is renowned for its clean shoreline and tranquil atmosphere. Surrounded by lush tree growth and offering a peaceful environment with fewer crowds, it provides a serene escape for tourists seeking natural beauty and quietude. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the sandy shore while feeling the cool water and warm sand beneath their feet.

sources.snippet: Elliot's Beach which is also known as Besant Nagar Beach lies approximately 13 kilometers away from central Chennai City itself. Elliot's beach is very popular among families and kids because it has clean sand with gentle waves that break far from shorelines to make swimming safe for children just like any other family-friendly tourist destination all over located within India.. A number of shops; cafes and eateries line up this area making it an active place throughout the year attracting Many visitors come here to swim when they visit Madras during their holidays on account of its trendy eateries outlets serving various types foodstuffs available there beside many shop stalls that have been set up here now.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Exotic Beaches Near Chennai For Your Next Getaway

sources.snippet: Elliot's Beach, also known as Besant Nagar Beach, is a popular coastal destination in Chennai, offering a tranquil escape with its sandy shores and gentle waves. Located in the Besant Nagar neighborhood, it's easily accessible from Chennai and provides opportunities for relaxing by the sea, taking leisurely strolls, and enjoying local seafood. Location: Besant Nagar, Chennai.Distance from Chennai: 13 kms from chennai city centreActivities: At Elliot's Beach, you can relax by the sea, take a leisurely walk along the scenic promenade, and savor the local seafood delicacies at the nearby restaurants.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: One of the cleanest beaches in Chennai is Elliot‚Äôs Beach ‚Äì situated in Besant Nagar, one of the hippest neighborhoods in the city. Enveloped in a friendly vibe, it is a must-visit beach, especially in the evenings when youngsters and families throng the beach. The clean promenade is dotted with trendy restaurants and cafes that see mostly youngsters out for the evening.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can‚Äôt Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Elliot‚Äôs beach is towards the eastern coast of Tamil Nadu and is considered as one of the cleanest beaches of Chennai. The Ashtalakshmi built on the sand in this beach is a major attraction. It is also very popular as a nightlife beach as scores of youngsters gather in the evenings and night time to hang out with friends and take pleasure in each other‚Äôs company.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Named after Edward Elliot, a former high-ranking bureaucrat in the erstwhile Madras Presidency, Elliot's beach is a strong contender amongst the best beach in Chennai. It is located in Besant Nagar and is also referred to as Besant Nagar Beach. Visitors are not barred from swimming, but are warned to do so at their own risk.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Chennai

sources.snippet: Elliot‚Äôs Beach is one very beautiful beach in Chennai, and what‚Äôs more, it is less dense and crowded than Marina. The sand here is brown, and very clean, while the Schmidt Memorial is a good sightseeing spot. It was built for Karl Schmidt, a Dutch sailor, and attracts visitors with its stories and beauty.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: This beach is one of the cleanest beaches in the city, situated near Beasant Nagar and also called as Adyar Beach. The beach is famous for its night life, and there are a number of eateries near the beach. The Ashtalakshmi Temple is also located on the sand of the Elliot‚Äôs beach.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Chennai, Marina Beach, Elliots Beach, Covelong Beach

sources.snippet: Otherwise called Besant Nagar Beach, Elliot‚Äôs Beach is a peaceful and less jam-packed option in contrast to Marina Beach. Named after Edward Elliot, the Chief Justice of Madras during the English provincial time, this beach is a favorite among locals.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

places.name: Edward Elliot's Beach

reviews.text:
Good place for early morning walking or jogging.

There are lot pigeons üïäÔ∏è come at early morning it looks awesome.

You can see sunrise üåÑ also.

Some unique street food shops are also available.

Overall nice experience üëç

Great beach near Besant nagar.  Very peaceful.
If you're taking a car only early mornings are recommended.  Evenings are livelier, with lots of activities, food and entertainment. But you can't park your car if you go later than 4.30pm. Bike or public transport is recommended in the Evenings. There are a lot of eateries around.
It was one of the best experiences in this beach.  Clean. Posh locality. Regular police surveillance. Lot of good cafes and restaurants around to enjoy the food. Good transport connectivity.

places.generalDescription: Marina Beach, a vibrant urban oasis located just 4 kilometers from Chennai Central Railway Station, is renowned for being the second longest beach in the world, stretching an impressive 13 kilometers. This bustling shoreline is a must-visit destination in Chennai, attracting tourists and locals alike with its lively atmosphere. As you stroll along the sandy expanse, you'll encounter kite sellers and cricket enthusiasts mingling with families enjoying quality time together.

sources.snippet: As one of the longest urban beaches in the world, Marina Beach holds a special place in the hearts of Chennai's residents. Stretching for approximately 13 km along the Bay of Bengal, Marina Beach offers a picturesque backdrop of rolling waves and clear blue skies. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the promenade, indulge in local street food delicacies, or simply bask in the beauty of the sunset over the horizon.
sources.shortName: Chennai Beaches: Exploring the coastal charms of Chennai; A guide to the best beaches

sources.snippet: Kite sellers, cricket enthusiasts, food stalls, families with kids and a bunch of sea gulls‚Ä¶that‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find at Chennai‚Äôs iconic Marina Beach. With one of the longest stretches of sand in an urban setting, Marina is definitely the most popular beach in Chennai and we strongly recommended a visit to watch the sun set into the Bay of Bengal (or the sunrise, if you are an early riser!). The promenade has a carnival like feel to it with many rides and activities for kids, food stalls selling bhajias and corn-on-the-cob and colorful crowds enjoying a walk amongst the many memorial statues and installations here.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can‚Äôt Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Marina Beach, one of the longest urban beaches in the world, stretches along the Bay of Bengal in Chennai, India. Located in the heart of the city, this iconic beach offers a pleasant escape with its sandy shores, bustling promenade, and opportunities for kite flying and enjoying local street food. Location: Chennai cityActivities: Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks, take in the view of the Bay of Bengal, fly kites, engage in beach sports, and savor delicious street food from the numerous stalls along the promenade.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: The Marina beach is one of the finest and the second longest in the world and ranks first in Asia. The Marina beach which adjoins the Bay of Bengal is located on the eastern side of the city and it stretches to about 12-km long. The beach is characterized by golden sand, good surf and a shimmering clean blue sea which becomes a ground for various entertainments especially in the evenings.
sources.shortName: CHENNAI BEACHES - MADRAS BEACHES

sources.snippet: Marina Beach stretches over 13 kilometers along Bay of Bengal making it among the longest town beaches in the world. Situated in the heart of Chennai; Marina Beach is best known as a place where you can relax as a local or visitor to this city. Sightseers have opportunities to get involved in such activities as horse riding and camel riding, picnicking on the beach among others.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Exotic Beaches Near Chennai For Your Next Getaway

sources.snippet: As yet another ValentineÔøΩs Day passed by (without any proposal either way), I longingly remembered the Marina Beach, a hotspot for lovers of Chennai. Madras (Chennai) and Marina go hand-in-hand together; you canÔøΩt separate one from the other. As you hear Madras, you canÔøΩt help visualizing the long sandy Marina with thrashing waves and throbbing with visitors.
sources.shortName: The Marina beach of Chennai By S Balakrishnan

sources.snippet: Marina Beach, near Triplicane, is India‚Äôs longest beach and the world‚Äôs second-longest beach. This predominantly sandy area of nearly 12 kilometres extends from Beasant Nagar in the south to Fort St. George in the north. It is a must-visit place for history lovers as they will get to see the magnificent statues of prominent dignitaries from Indian history.
sources.shortName: A comprehensive guide to Chennai's Beaches: Tourist Attractions for all Travellers

sources.snippet: The Marina Beach Chennai is similar in beauty and size to the Copacabana Beach in Brazil and the beaches in Bali and the Bahamas. The name was given by Monstuart Elphinstone Grant-Duff, the Governor of Madras from 1881-1886. Grant-Duff was instrumental in conceiving and converting what was a strip of mud to the present day beach with a beautiful promenade.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach in Chennai

sources.snippet: As far as beaches go, Marina beach tops the list, thanks to where it‚Äôs located. Marina beach itself is one of the iconic beaches in the state and is the longest urban beach in India. With more than 100 stalls for food and snacks, a lighthouse to watch the sunset, and several monuments all in one stretch, Marina Beach is where Chennai‚Äôs heart belongs.
sources.shortName: Madras Day: Best Places To See In Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach has a rich and fascinating history that dates back to the 19th century. It was developed by the British governor of Madras (now Chennai), Sir Mountstuart Elphinstone Grant Duff, who wanted to create a promenade along the coast for the residents of the city. He named it after the Italian word ‚Äúmarina‚Äù, which means ‚Äúshore‚Äù or ‚Äúcoast‚Äù.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach: A Complete Guide to Chennai‚Äôs Iconic Beach

sources.snippet: Marina Beach is among the most popular beaches in Chennai and firmly holds down its place among the must-visit beaches. It is the longest beach in India and ranks second among the longest beaches in the world. Crowds consisting of solo travellers, families frequent this beach to enjoy some quality time, while enjoying the cool sea breeze.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Chennai | Beaches near Chennai

sources.snippet: Overlooking the sea, the Ashtalakshmi Temple majestically stands on the shores of Elliot‚Äôs Beach. Consecrated in 1976, the temple is dedicated to the 8 forms of Goddess Lakshmi, believed to be the bestower of wealth and prosperity in Hinduism. The temple has a multi-tier structure, measuring a length of 65 feet and a breadth of 45 feet.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing, Eateries, Adventure & Shopping Spots

sources.snippet: Marina beach is full of activity in the early morning hours and in the evenings. Walking along the beaches during sunrise and sunset is a pleasant experience for all. In the evening this beach becomes a fair ground with numerous stalls selling artifacts, handcrafted showpieces, ethnic jewelry, and food items.
sources.shortName: Marina Beach | Chennai District

sources.snippet: Marina Beach is the most famous beach in Tamil Nadu and is the second largest beach in terms of the coastline it covers which is 13kms. One can take horse ride down the beach and there are a number of sights to witness near the beach. The best time to visit is during the months of November to February.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Chennai, Marina Beach, Elliots Beach, Covelong Beach

sources.snippet: Located amidst the city of Chennai the Marina beach is both historically and geographically significant for India. Situated along the Bay of Bengal its total length spans to over a distance of 13 kilometres. This kind of justifies the fact that it is called as the world‚Äôs second longest urban beach.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches In and Around Chennai

sources.snippet: You simply cannot have a conversation about beaches in Chennai without mentioning Marina Beach. It is the longest urban beach in India and quite possibly the first name that comes to mind when mentioning Chennai. It spans over 12 km and is the pride of Chennai.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach of Chennai is the second longest beach in the world. It has a 12km long coastline that is enclosed with palm trees along the promenade. It is a great tourist spot where you can spot locals taking long walks and enjoying the calm sea-breeze.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: This beach has etched a mark on the world map as the second longest beach all over the world and the longest one in India. It stretches to a total of 13 kms. The Marina beach is in continuation with the Bay of Bengal on the Eastern coast of India.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach, the world‚Äôs second-largest beach, serves as a prominent landmark of Chennai. It‚Äôs a place where locals and visitors alike have created cherished memories. A stroll along this coastal paradise is all it takes to free your mind.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Marina Beach isn‚Äôt simply a beach; it‚Äôs a famous milestone and the second-longest urban beach in the world. Extending for around 13 kilometers along the Cove of Bengal, it offers stunning perspectives and a dynamic climate.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

places.name: Marina Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful place , Location, View Point, It is so Amazing we had enjoyed a lot. With being longest coastal areas. We have walked a very long distance in the coastal lines to enjoy the view from different parts.

Marina Beach is truly the soul of Chennai! It's one of the longest urban beaches in the world, and the moment you step onto its golden sands, you're welcomed by the soothing sound of waves and a refreshing sea breeze.

This place is an absolute masterpiece by nature. While in the morning with the cold air reaching and the sound of Ocean is just go mind relaxing. I give it a 4 star because of garbage and litter. Otherwise, the atmosphere of the place is extremely good. Best place to picnic or just explore and swim in water. The ocean was kinda salty too.

places.generalDescription: Akkarai Beach is a laid-back and serene destination, offering a peaceful atmosphere away from the bustling crowds. Located in South Chennai, it provides a sandy coastline stretching from Ennore to Uthandi, making it an ideal alternative to the more popular Marina and Elliot's beaches. The area features well-constructed walking paths, comfortable seating, ample lighting, green spaces, and children's playgrounds for added convenience.

sources.snippet: The sandy coastline begins from Ennore in the north extending south into Uthandi, leaving one to choose from more than just Marina and Elliot's beach. With nicely constructed walkers' paths, convenient seats, adequate lighting, lush green areas and children's playgrounds proposed for select beaches in Chennai initially, there is more to look forward to when you clock in some time for fitness. Location: South Chennai, 24 Km from city centreDistance from Chennai: 25kms Activities: At Akkarai Beach, you can enjoy activities like picnicking, swimming, and simply relaxing by the sea.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking to go to someplace with your friends or family where you can spend your time doing something new every hour then the VGP Golden beach near Akkarai Beach is the best destination for you. Situated in the city of Chennai along the Bay of Bengal, it is a private beach attached to the VGP Universal Kingdom, an amusement park which will spark up your life. Mr. VG Paneerdas had developed the Golden Beach and the VGP Universal Kingdom with the vision of creating a thrilling and engaging site for families or friends to spend their time at.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches In and Around Chennai

sources.snippet: One of the most scenic routes in the country is the East Coast Road in TN, running right along the Bay of Bengal and a drive through here will bring you to equally beautiful destinations ‚Äì all those quiet, serene beaches, unspoilt and near-pristine. Of all these beaches, we recommend a trip to Akkarai ‚Äì the best of beaches in Chennai. It does not have the carnival-like vibe of Marina or Elliot‚Äôs, it does not have the cafes and restaurants that other beaches boast of and not nearly half as many people.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can‚Äôt Miss in 2024

places.name: Akkarai Beach

reviews.text:
Akkarai Beach, located in Chennai, is a pristine and tranquil beach that offers a refreshing escape from the bustling city life. The beach is relatively less crowded compared to other popular beaches in the city, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll, a relaxing day by the sea, or a romantic sunset.

Time to Visit - 6-8am
Suggested Duration - 1-2 hours

What to expect?
At Akkarai Beach, you can expect a serene atmosphere, gentle sea breeze, and captivating views of the ocean. The beach is perfect for a leisurely stroll, relaxing under the shade of palm trees, or engaging in beach games with friends and family. The beach also offers stunning views of the sunrise and sunset, making it an ideal spot for photography enthusiasts and nature lovers.

Tips
1. Wear comfortable footwear suitable for walking on sand.
2. Carry essentials like sunscreen, sunglasses, and a hat to protect yourself from the sun.
3. Be mindful of the local environment and avoid littering or disturbing the natural surroundings.
4. Swimming may not be advisable due to strong currents; always exercise caution and follow local guidelines.

Beach Vibe - 5/5
Cleanliness - 3.5/5
Location - 4/5
Maintenance - 2.5/5
Good beach for OMR/ECR residents. No shops in the morning. Just the beautiful sun & the sea! You can find lot of shops in the evening time. Parking can be tricky during peak hours.

Beach Vibe - 5/5
Cleanliness - 3.5/5
Location - 4/5
Maintenance - 2.5/5

places.generalDescription: Golden Beach, a gem in Tamil Nadu, is celebrated for its stunning natural beauty and vibrant atmosphere. This picturesque destination features a long stretch of soft golden sands that meet the clear blue waters, creating an idyllic setting for relaxation and enjoyment with family and friends. The beach's pristine surroundings make it perfect for swimming, walking, or jogging along the shore.

sources.snippet: Consistent with its name, Golden Beach offers golden sands and a lively environment. This family-friendly beach is furnished with present-day conveniences and water sports facilities, making it an ideal destination for a fun-filled day out.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: The first amusement park in Chennai, just about 11 Kms away from Adyar. Still a landmark of Chennai, this park offers over 40 odd rides for the fun seeker. The only park with an access to the beach
sources.shortName: CHENNAI BEACHES - MADRAS BEACHES

places.name: Golden Beach

reviews.text:
But I was in Marina not golden beach.
Being a new moon day, enjoyed the raising of waves each time as time went all. Wonderful for families. Bring kids to enjoy the water running under their legs. Even the scared one later would not come out of it .

Golden Beach in Chennai is a picturesque coastal haven, blending natural beauty with fun-filled activities. The soft, golden sands and soothing waves make it ideal for leisurely strolls or unwinding by the shore. Adjacent to the amusement park, it offers thrilling rides and water sports, perfect for families and adventure seekers. Clean and well-kept, the beach also boasts delicious local eateries. A vibrant yet tranquil escape, Golden Beach is a Chennai treasure worth exploring.

Marina Beach offers a captivating experience with its vast expanse of golden sand and the rhythmic sounds of the waves. Visitors often appreciate the vibrant atmosphere, with families, joggers, and tourists enjoying the scenic beauty. The beach is a popular spot for leisurely strolls and enjoying local street food. Sunset at Marina Beach is particularly cherished, providing a breathtaking view. While some reviews mention the crowd, many find the overall experience to be refreshing and culturally rich.

places.address: 27WJ+W98, Greams Rd, Thousand Lights West, Thousand Lights, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600006, India

places.generalDescription: Palavakkam Beach is a tranquil escape that beautifully marries natural splendor with cultural depth. Nestled at the southern tip of Chennai, this picturesque beach features soft golden sands and inviting blue waters, making it an ideal spot for relaxation. The vibrant local fishing community adds life to the serene atmosphere, while an ancient temple nearby enriches the area‚Äôs historical allure.

sources.snippet: Palavakkam Beach is a serene haven that offers a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural richness. Known for its pristine golden sands and tranquil blue waters, this beach stands as a testament to Chennai‚Äôs well-preserved coastal charm. The rhythm of local fishing life adds a vibrant touch to the peaceful surroundings, while the presence of an ancient temple infuses the area with historical significance.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Remember those scenes from old movies where people went to beaches that weren‚Äôt too crowded, where you could sit on a bench and just enjoy the views of the sea and the cool breeze while kids played in the sand?. You can still have that. At Palavakkam, one of the finest beaches in Chennai, where ‚Äòreel‚Äô becomes ‚Äòreal‚Äô and you really do get to do all those things.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can‚Äôt Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Located at the southern tip of Chennai in Palavakkam, Palavakkam Beach is a wonderful beach boasting of mesmerising sunrise and sunset views. The highlight of the beach is an age-old temple situated on the beach. The beach has the vast expanse of shores, with stunning views of the horizon merging in the sea.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: Palavakkam Ocean side offers a blend of serenity and experience. The beach is known for its lively climate and is a famous spot for beach volleyball.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

places.name: Palavakkam beach

reviews.text: A beautiful and clean beach in Chennai. The view at night was absolutely amazing and peaceful. It wasn't crowded even during the weekends. If you're planning to visit at night make sure to stay near the shops as it is brighter in that area at night which will be a safer option.

It's a clean beach and especially if your Parents love to visit beach ‚Ä¶ it will be very easy for them to walk to the seashore from parking its a very short distance from the road.

You can enjoy some quality family time there without any hassle. The colour of the water is so pleasant to watchüòäüòé
A calm environment and peace ambience.. No interruptions like Sellers and Stores in the beach part..

places.address: Palavakkam Beach Rd, Kottivakkam Kuppam, Palavakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the stunning coastline, Blue Lagoon Beach Resort is a vibrant getaway that promises a blend of relaxation and adventure. This serene resort features charming cottage rentals, an inviting swimming pool complete with an artificial waterfall, and lush gardens perfect for leisurely strolls or family gatherings. Ideal for corporate retreats or family reunions, it offers beach-facing rooms where guests can wake up to the soothing sound of waves.

sources.snippet: Among the other famous beach resorts in ecr, a known one is the Blue Lagoon Beach Resort. Noted for its tranquil settings and picturesque gardens, the place is ideal for family parties, reunion and wedding receptions.You can wake up to the lovely view of the crashing waves as all the rooms are beach facing. Adorned with modern amenities, a cozy stay is certainly assured.
sources.shortName: 20 Beach Resorts in Chennai, Book Now & Get Upto 50% Off

places.name: Blue Lagoon Beach Resort

reviews.text: It was really a memorable and enjoyable day @ blue lagoon beach resort. I'm really admired by the place with safe children play park, beautiful swimming pool and breezy beach. The taste of the meal is really the best one. We enjoyed a lot. It is perfect place for a perfect day out

Very good resort at a great location. Have ample space for family / team activities with good parking. Have conducted and attended multiple events here. Rooms are not that great though. Food is fine, but not excellent or great. Service is good, but cannot except finesse. Swimming pool have to be booked in advance. Price is optimal. Overall good.

We had a family get together here. Our experience with the pool and water fall was awesome. Totally enjoyed it. Food was super delicious. Although there's a lot of crowd, everything was organised very well. Place is clean and hygienic. Service too was prompt and good. Overall a very good experience

places.address: 5/72, East Coast Rd, Raja Nagar, Neelankarai, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600115, India

places.generalDescription: Kovalam Beach, located about 40 km south of Chennai along the picturesque East Coast Road, is a hidden gem that offers a perfect retreat from urban life. With its soft sands and crystal-clear waters, this beach attracts both sunbathers and adventure seekers alike. Visitors can enjoy thrilling activities like surfing or simply relax under the sun while taking in the stunning coastal views.

sources.snippet: Kovalam Beach is located on the Coromandel Coast and is as popular as Marina Beach. Located about 40 kilometres from Chennai it is one of the must-visit beaches near Chennai. Partake in a number of water-based activities such as parasailing, paragliding, jet skiing, scuba diving and more when you visit this beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Chennai | Beaches near Chennai

sources.snippet: Kovalam Beach is a popular spot for surfing and other thrilling water sports. Being one of just 10 beaches in India to get a blue flag certification for being environmentally-friendly. The aquatic beach is also a well-known habitat for dolphins, so if you are lucky you may spot one or two occasionally!
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Chennai

places.name: Kovalam Beach

reviews.text: I have been visiting this beach for a long time, and the sunrise here is truly beautiful. Many people also come to buy fresh fish brought in by small boats, while the bigger catches are available from 3 pm onwards. Compared to earlier days, the beach is now maintained much cleaner, making the visit even more enjoyable.

Quiet very active beach with lots of people hitting it during weekends. Enjoy a refreshing bath, eat sea food and veg snacks.

Only downside is the roads are narrow nearer to the beach and parking your cars is a bit of a challenge. However if you manage to travel through the crowd this is a place to enjoy!

Mamallapuram is a short drive from here, that you can visit.

I recently visited Kovalam Beach, and honestly, it felt so good to be there. The entire vibe of the place is calm and peaceful. The sound of the waves hitting the shore, the cool breeze, and the salty smell of the ocean instantly refreshed my mood.

But the best part was the sunset It was magical. Watching the sun slowly set into the sea, spreading beautiful shades of orange, pink, and purple across the sky, made me feel so happy and peaceful inside. I couldn't take my

eyes off it.

If you ever want to relax and just clear your mind, Kovalam Beach is a perfect place. Sit on the sand, sip some coconut w*~r, and watch the sunset. It will r our day beautiful.

places.address: Poongavanapuram, Vadapalani, Chennai, Kovalam, Tamil Nadu 600003, India

places.generalDescription: Kasimedu Beach is a lesser-known spot in Chennai, located about 10 km from the city center. It's not just a recreational beach but also an important fishing harbor. The sandy stretch offers picturesque views of boats and a pleasant sea breeze for leisurely walks along the pier. While it's not suitable for swimming due to its function as a man-made bridge for accessing fishing boats, it provides a unique experience different from the more popular Marina Beach.

sources.snippet: When you want to spend a weekend like the locals you go to Kasimedu, one of the most popular beaches in Chennai. Loved for its beautiful pier, colorful boats and the stunning views of the sea it affords, Kasimedu Beach is where Chennai goes to unwind on a Sunday evening. You will see families with kids strolling along the beach, youngsters playing volleyball or cricket and even people fishing on the shore with home-made fishing lines.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Beaches in Chennai That You Can‚Äôt Miss in 2024

sources.snippet: Kasimedu Beach is more than just a scenic retreat; it‚Äôs a vibrant hub of local culture and commerce. Known for its bustling fish market and serene seaside views, this beach offers a unique blend of natural beauty and bustling activity. As one of Chennai‚Äôs primary fishing centers, Kasimedu Beach provides a fascinating glimpse into the daily life of the local fishing community.
sources.shortName: Popular Beaches in Chennai

sources.snippet: Kasimedu Beach is comparatively lesser-known among the beaches in Chennai. It is not just a recreation spot but also an important fishing harbour. With a vast expanse of the blue sea and brown sandy shores, you can also find several fishermen at work with their huge fishing nets and boats.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches in Chennai (2024)

sources.snippet: Kasimedu Beach, with its vibrant fishing harbor, offers a brief look into the customary vocations of Chennai‚Äôs coastal communities. Witness the clamoring activities of fishermen and savor the authenticity of this lively coastal area.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Famous Beaches in Chennai

places.name: Kasimedu Beach

reviews.text:
When I feel sad or happy, I need to go and spend the time here mostly, but most of the time I spend time with family members only, I call here. All are interested, they get ready very quickly and they don't waste time at home. We are very special to earth because we have a beach nearby.. enjoy life.. And we have more beach places wherever we will go. It's amazing only, my mom, whenever she goes to the beach she will enjoy it much more.. I spent the first time with my wife and daughter with nature here only, they also enjoyed it.. During college time also I came here more times with my friends, i can't able to write my experience because words can't explain me and my friends enjoyment, happiness and more memorable moments, people i saw here all are very excited and enjoying the nature of beauty, people are came here very long drive and they're all enjoyed and happiness the Beach. I came here when I was in 10th standard with my friends, then I had a lot of fun with them and learned a lot of information. I like to share some happiness here. That's all.. enjoy life more..

Good beach and great sea breeze through out the  walking stretch along with the beach. You cannot reach to the sea water as this is a man made bridge (road) to access the fishing boats. It is far better breeze and nice experience than Marina Beach. There is no sand in it just a road with stones and concrete blocks to safeguard the road.

If you are in a 2 wheelers, you can go till the end of the fishing harbour. Better to leave the place before sun set.

Mostly, local people will be in the beach.
Government must think and improve the infrastructure and conditions of the entire place like a ‚ÄúSmart City‚Äù. It is completely  unattended to improve anything beyond the fishing market which is very sad part.

I was awestruck by the scenic beauty of this beach located in North chennai. Huge fishing boats are parked there. Early morning you will get fresh catch from the sea. Please bargain as they quote high prices.
